Question:
A student wishes to measure directly the circumference of a football.
What is the most suitable instrument to use?
Which equation contains two vector quantities?

Options.A: acceleration = change in velocity / time taken
Options.B: average speed = distance travelled / time taken
Options.D: volume = length x width x height

Question:
Forces of 6.0 N and 8.0 N act as shown. 
Which diagram shows the resultant R of these two forces?

A speed-time graph for the journey of a car is shown. 
What is the distance-time graph for the journey?

The gravitational field strength on Earth is 9.8 N / kg. 
The gravitational field strength on Mars is 3.7 N / kg. 
The difference between the weight of an object on Earth and the weight of the same object on Mars is 25 N. 
What is the mass of the object?

A student determines the density of a solid metal cube. 
Which pieces of equipment does the student use?

Options.A: a balance and a force meter
Options.C: a micrometer and a measuring cylinder
Options.D: a ruler and a measuring cylinder

Question:
The diagram shows the only two horizontal forces acting on a trolley that is accelerating at 0.12 m / s^2. 
What is the mass of the trolley?

A spring is stretched to different lengths by a variable force. 
The graph shows how the size of the force depends on the length to which the spring is stretched. 
What is the spring constant k of the spring?

A uniform horizontal beam, pivoted at its right-hand end, is in equilibrium. A force of 60 N acts vertically upwards on the beam as shown. 
What is the weight of the beam?

A constant frictional force acts on a moving object for a short amount of time causing the momentum of the object to decrease. 
Which expression is used to calculate the time for which the force acts?

A large stone is rolled onto a lorry using a ramp. 
The length of the ramp is l. 
The stone is lifted a height of h. 
The mass of the stone is m. The weight of the stone is W. 
Which expression is equal to the useful work done on the stone?

The diagram shows a burning candle. 
Which energy store is associated with the burning candle?

An African elephant has a mass of 6000 kg and each of its four feet has an area of 0.20 m^2. The gravitational field strength g is 9.8 N / kg. 
What is the average pressure due to the elephant when it is standing stationary on all four feet on level ground?
Which row describes the shape and the volume of a liquid at constant temperature?

Options.D: not fixed shape, not fixed volume

Question: Which row shows how the forces and the distances between the particles in a solid generally compare with the forces and distances in a liquid?

An incomplete statement about latent heat is given. 
Latent heat is the ......1...... required to overcome the bonds between molecules and change the ......2...... of a substance. 
Which words are inserted into gap 1 and gap 2 to correctly complete the sentence?

A cold solid is placed on top of a hot solid. 
Thermal energy is transferred from the hot solid to the cold one. 
What is the explanation for this?

Options.A: A hot solid expands, so its particles will move further apart.
Options.B: Energy is transferred from one particle to the next.
Options.D: Molecules are free to move randomly through the solids.

Question:
A house is to be thermally insulated to reduce thermal energy loss and reduce fuel costs. 
Which type of thermal insulation pays back the cost of installation in the shortest time?

The diagram shows two divergent rays of light from an object O being reflected from a plane mirror. 
At which position is the image formed?

Light is incident on a mirror at an angle of 45° as shown. 
The mirror can be rotated about an axis into the page through point X. 
The mirror is rotated until the light is reflected back along its original path. 
Through which angle is the mirror rotated?

A ray of light is incident on a plastic block in air, at an angle of incidence i. The refractive index of the plastic is n.
The light ray refracts along the plastic-air boundary when it reaches X.
Which equation is correct?

The diagram shows white light entering a prism.
What happens at point X and what is the colour of the light that strikes the screen at point Z?
Which row names a region of the electromagnetic spectrum with a wavelength longer than that of visible light and a region with a frequency that is greater than that of visible light?

Sound travels at different speeds in different states of matter.
Which list gives the three states of matter arranged in order of the speed of sound from slowest to fastest?

Bar magnets and various non-magnetic and demagnetised metal bars are placed in the different arrangements shown.
In which arrangement do the bars repel?

A student uses a wooden clamp and a stand to hold a freely suspended bar magnet.
The diagrams show that:
- in experiment 1, the student holds a bar magnet next to the suspended magnet
- in experiment 2, the student holds an iron bar next to the suspended magnet
- in experiment 3, the student holds a steel bar next to the suspended magnet.
In which experiments does the suspended magnet move?

In an electrostatics experiment, a plastic rod is rubbed with a cloth.
The cloth becomes negatively charged.
Which diagram shows the charge on the rod and describes the movement of charge?

Options.A: protons move from the cloth on to the rod
Options.B: electrons move from the rod on to the cloth
Options.C: electrons move from the cloth on to the rod
Options.D: protons move from the rod on to the cloth

Question:
Object X is stationary and positively charged. It experiences a force due to the field produced by object Y.
The arrows show the direction of the field produced by Y.
Which statement about the direction of the force on X is correct?

Options.A: It is towards the right because it is in an electric field.
Options.B: It is towards the left because it is in an electric field.
Options.C: It is towards the right because it is in a magnetic field.
Options.D: It is towards the left because it is in a magnetic field.

Question:
The diagram shows a battery of three 1.5 V cells.
What is an advantage of this arrangement of cells?

Options.A: The battery can supply a current for a longer time than a single 1.5 V cell.
Options.B: The battery can supply any e.m.f. between 0 V and 4.5 V.
Options.C: The battery supplies more energy to each coulomb of charge than a single 1.5 V cell.
Options.D: The e.m.f. of the battery is 4.5 V.

Question:
A potential divider consists of a light-dependent resistor (LDR) and a resistor connected to a 6.0 V battery.
The output is 3.0 V.
What is the resistance of the LDR?

Three students each suggest a consequence of wiring lamps in parallel rather than in series.
student 1 If one lamp breaks, the other lamps stay lit.
student 2 The lamps can be switched on and off separately.
student 3 The p.d. across each lamp is equal to the p.d. across the supply.
Which students are correct?

When wire XY is moved downwards between the poles of a stationary magnet, an e.m.f. is produced across X and Y.
Which action produces an e.m.f. across X and Y in the opposite direction?

Options.A: Move both the wire and the magnet upwards at the same speed.
Options.B: The wire is kept stationary and the magnet is moved upwards.
Options.C: The wire is moved downwards and the magnet is moved upwards.
Options.D: The wire is moved upwards and the magnet is kept stationary.

Question:
An a.c. voltage is displayed on an oscilloscope screen. The Y-gain is set at 2.0 V/cm.
What is the maximum value of the voltage?

The results of a scattering experiment show that a very small nucleus contains most of the matter in an atom.
What is scattered in this experiment?

Atoms P and Q are isotopes of the same element.
How does the composition of an atom of P compare with the composition of an atom of Q?
Topic: 5.1 The Nuclear Model of the Atom

Question:
The nucleus of an atom emits an alpha-particle.
How do the proton number and nucleon number change?
Topic: 5.1 The Nuclear Model of the Atom

Question:
The diagram shows how the thickness of paper is measured during manufacture.
If the sheet is too thick, fewer beta-particles can reach the detector.

Options.A: Alpha-particles are all stopped by the paper.
Options.C: Gamma radiation is all stopped by the paper.
Options.D: Gamma radiation is only produced by sources with a short half-life.

Question:
A sample of tritium has a mass of 32 mg.
Tritium has a half-life of 12 years.
How much of the sample of tritium decays in 36 years?

It takes 27 days for the Moon to orbit the Earth.
The average value of the radius of the Moon's orbit is 3.8 x 10^8 m.
What is the average orbital speed of the Moon?
What is the nuclear reaction that takes place in stable stars?

Options.A: fission of helium to produce hydrogen
Options.B: fission of hydrogen to produce helium
